bug.short_desc: autocomplete - import sometimes adds import line and sometimes not

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20071023-1652
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Type a class in the Java editor that needs to be imported 2. position the cursor after the class and press CTRL-SPACE 3. Sometimes a new line is added that imports the class. As far as I know this is the desired behaviour. But also sometimes the full package specification is inserted before the class. This is not what I want. Deleting the package spec. and going back to step 2 (a couple of times if necessary) will eventually give the desired result: That an import line is added.
More information: This didn't happen before I started using Eclipse 3.3, except when there was a naming conflict.
I have been trying to figure out if this annoying behaviour only occurs in specific circumstances but haven't been able to find anything. I seems to occur completely at random.
I am experiencing this at 2 pc's, both running Ubuntu (Gutsy) and Java 6.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 210636 ***
